description: Object storage, file systems, and block storage solutions

aws.name: Amazon S3
aws.pricing_model: Pay-per-GB stored, requests, and data transfer

azure.name: Azure Blob Storage
azure.description: Massively scalable object storage for unstructured data
azure.pricing_model: Pay-per-GB with Hot, Cool, and Archive tiers

migration_notes: Blob Storage has access tiers (Hot, Cool, Archive) similar to S3 storage classes
Azure containers map to S3 buckets - different naming conventions
Both support lifecycle management policies for cost optimization
Azure has geo-redundant storage options similar to S3 cross-region replication
REST API operations are similar but syntax differs - use Azure Storage SDK
learning_resources: S3 to Blob Storage migration tool

aws.name: Amazon EBS
aws.description: High-performance block storage for EC2 instances

azure.name: Azure Managed Disks
azure.description: High-performance managed block storage for VMs

migration_notes: Azure Managed Disks eliminate the need for storage accounts (unlike unmanaged disks)
Performance tiers: Standard HDD, Standard SSD, Premium SSD, Ultra Disk
Encryption at rest is enabled by default in Azure
Snapshot and backup capabilities are built-in
Zone-redundant storage available for high availability
learning_resources: EBS to Managed Disks migration guide

aws.name: Amazon EFS
aws.description: Fully managed NFS file system for EC2

azure.name: Azure Files
azure.description: Fully managed file shares using SMB and NFS protocols

migration_notes: Azure Files supports both SMB and NFS protocols (EFS only supports NFS)
Can be mounted simultaneously by cloud and on-premises deployments
Azure File Sync provides hybrid cloud file services
Performance tiers: Standard and Premium with different IOPS limits
Integration with Azure AD for identity-based authentication
